results.title: The Last starfighter
results.creator_credit: Nick Castle, Edward Denault, Gary Adelson, Lorimar Film Entertainment and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: A highly underrated science fiction produced in the wake of the Star Wars phenomenon, “The Last starfighter” is another supreme example of outer-space/fantasy that was the trend in Hollywood in the early 1980s. Lance Guest is Alex Rogan, who lives and works a dead-end job in his mother’s trailer park. His only escape: a video-game called “Starfighter”. When a mysterious stranger explains to him that “Starfighter” is more than just a game, Alex is thrust centrestage for a conflict that threatens not only Earth but the entire universe. With production design by Ron Cobb (of ‘Alien’ and ‘Star Wars’ fame) and a scorching soundtrack by Craig Safan, “The Last starfighter” is formulaic Hollywood at its most entertaining. Cast also includes Robert Preston, Dan O’Herlihy, Catherine Stewart and Barbara Bosson.

results.title: Johnny Suede
results.creator_credit: Tom Di Cillo, Ruth Waldburger, Yoram Mandel, Arena Films, Balthazar Pictures and Starr Pictures
results.brief_description: An independent off-beat cult classic about an aspiring rock musician with a complicated love life and an obsession for suede and his own carefully cultivated self-image. Johnny (Brad Pitt) is a naive but endearing musician who models himself on the 1950s pop legend, Ricky Nelson. After a pair of black suede shoes fall on him from the sky one night, he adopts the name Johnny Suede and spends his time composing inspired love songs on his guitar that add greatly to the comic and somewhat bizarre quality of the film as he dreams of rock ‘n’ roll stardom. He meets the sensuous painter Yvonne (Catherine Keener) and begins a journey of self discovery that will never quite leave his carefully fabricated image the same again, or will it? Written and directed by Tom DiCillo, who followed this genuine and beautifully odd ball effort with ‘Living in Oblivion’(1994), said to be inspired in part by his experiences in making this film, and including a cast that features Nick Cave and Tina Louise. (Awards: Golden Leopard Award for Best Film, 1991)

results.title: Shanghai triad
results.creator_credit: Zhang Yimou, Jean-Louis Piel, Wu Yigong and Shanghai Film Studio
results.brief_description: Set in the 1930s, this film centres on the coming of age of Shuisheng, a country boy brought to Shanghai by his uncle to work for the powerful gang ruled by Tang. He finds himself working for Bijou, Tang’s capricious mistress and nightclub singer. When Shuisheng’s uncle and several other gang members are killed during a rival gang’s unsuccessful attempt on Tang’s life, the latter escapes to a remote island taking both Bijou and Shuisheng with him and thinking of revenge. In Mandarin with English subtitles. Cast includes: Gong Li, Li Baotian, Li Xuejian, Sun Chun and Wang Xiaoxiao.

results.title: Miracle fighters = Qimen dunjia [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Yuen Woo-Ping, Raymond Chow, Golden Harvest and Wo Ping Films
results.brief_description: In this crazed live-action cartoon story of sorcery and supernatural vengeance, legendary director Yuen Woo Ping orchestrates a manic martial arts fantasy extravaganza. A young disciple of some elderly ‘miracle fighters’—martial arts instructors who also possess magical powers—is mistaken for the long missing crown prince. The emperor dispatches a eunuch named Sorcerer Bat to apprehend the boy but first he must get rid of his elderly guardians. The climatic set-piece, an amazing sequence of pure kung fu action, takes place in hell where the eunuch and the young disciple are forced into a contest to determine who is more powerful. Filled with eccentric characters and comic moments as well as a succession of battles, this film spawned four sequels. Cast includes Yuen Yat Choh, Leung Kar Yan, Yuen Cheung Yan. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: The River = He Liu
results.creator_credit: Tsai Ming-liang, Chiu Shun-ching, Ligong Xu and Central Motion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: This film centres around Xiao-kang, an unemployed youth, and his dysfunctional family. Living with his parents in Taipei, there is little communication in the house, where his mother is having an affair with a hawker of pornographic videos, and his retired father frequents a gay bathhouse. Although unmotivated to do anything to alter his life, things change for Xiao-kang when he encounters an old friend from the past, who is currently working on a film shoot near a river. She convinces Xiao-kang to work as an extra in the film, which entailed floating in a polluted river, after which he develops a mysterious and agonising pain in his neck. In Mandarin with English subtitles. Cast includes: Miao Tien, Lee Kang-sheng, Lu Hsiao-ling and Anne Hui

results.title: Land without music
results.creator_credit: Walter Forde, Max Schach, Capitol Film Corporation and J H Productions
results.brief_description: A light-hearted operetta composed by Oscar Straus and adapted for the screen by Rudolf Bernauer based on a supposedly true story that took place in the early part of the 19th century. It is a tale of forbidden music where no instruments or singing is allowed in order that the townsfolk can concentrate on more serious things such as making money to pay off the town’s debts. Stars Richard Tauber as Mario Carlini and features Jimmy Durante (Schnozzle) as Jonah J. Whistler. Cast also includes Diana Napier (Princess Regent), June Clyde (Sadie Whistler), Derrick de Marney (Rudolpho Strozzi, Esme Percy (Austrian Ambassador).

results.title: Doing time for Patsy Cline
results.creator_credit: Chris Kennedy, John Winter and Oilrag Productions
results.brief_description: Ralph, a country boy who has just left his parents farm to seek fame and fortune as a country singer in Nashville, hitches a ride with a drug dealer, Boyd, and his girlfriend Patsy. Within 24 hours Boyd and Ralph are arrested and locked up in a country jail. Set against a background of country music and shifting between the present and Ralph’s daydreams, in which he fantasises about finding success in Nashville with the alluring Patsy, the film embraces the bittersweet pathos that characterises the country music genre. Cast includes Richard Roxburgh, Miranda Otto, Matt Day, Tony Barry and Kiri Paramore.

results.title: Blue steel
results.creator_credit: Kathryn Bigelow, Edward Pressman, Oliver Stone and Lightening Pictures
results.brief_description: A steadily paced thriller from director Kathryn Bigelow starring Jamie Lee Curtis as Megan Turner, a recently graduated New York cop who is stalked by the same murdering mad man that she is investigating. An outcast in her family and in constant difficulty when it comes to relationships as a result of her occupation, suffering chastisement even within the career path she has devoted herself to, the start of a new passionate romance with Eugene Hunt (Ron Silver) has all the appearance of a turn around in her fortunes. However, little is as it seems and with the help of a fellow officer she is forced to confront her obsessive nemesis and her own self-doubts and fears. This film is a suspenseful and psychological drama with an unexpected and insightful angle on the nature of human needs and desires and the complexities of human relationships in the contemporary and ever anonymous city. Kathryn Bigelow develops a dream-like perspective on the characters and turn of events in the film, an early example of her fluid style of direction.

results.title: Amateur
results.creator_credit: Hal Hartley, Ted Hope, True Fiction Pictures, UGC Images and Zenith Entertainment
results.brief_description: A quirky and absurdist comic thriller from writer/director, Hal Hartley. Isabelle (Isabelle Huppert) is an ex-nun awaiting an expected mission from God while making a living writing stories for pornographic magazines. She meets the kind and confused Thomas (Martin Donovan), who is suffering from amnesia and wandering the streets of New York in search of clues to his past, a past of viciousness and exploitation that only the appearance of his traumatized porn queen ex-wife, Sophia (Elina Lowensohn), begins to unravel. Intertwined with suspenseful thriller qualities and the subtlety of an unlikely romance, this film quietly spirals into a poignant tale of the pursuit of the reality of identity through memory and engagement with the past which leads sensitively to the inevitable tragedy of the final showdown.

results.title: Witchfinder General
results.creator_credit: Michael Reeves, Arnold Louis Miller, Louis M Heyward and Philip Waddilove
results.brief_description: The sinister subject of this film becomes apparent in the opening scene, where shots of an old woman being dragged, screaming, through the streets of a village are juxtaposed against those of a lone figure calmly tending the gallows on a barren, windswept hilltop. It is 1645, and England is in the grip of civil war. As law and order collapses, and unrest plagues the populace, cries of witchcraft begin to echo across the land. Soldier Richard Marshall (Ian Ogilvy) finally gains permission from John Lowes, the priest of Branderston, to marry his niece, Sara (Hilary Dwyer), as long as he promises to take her away to another village. As Richard returns to his regiment, Matthew Hopkins (Vincent Price) and his sadistic assistant, John Stearne, ride into town, seeking a priest who allegedly worships Satan. John Lowes is tracked down and tortured, until Hopkins lays eyes on Sara, and agrees to suspend the death sentence if Sara allows him to come to her bed-chamber and “question her”. In exchange for her uncle’s life, Sara agrees, and all is well until one night Stearne follows Hopkins to her home and learns why the priest has received a reprieve. While Hopkins is away on business in the neighbouring town, Stearne corners Sara and rapes her. One of the men who accused John Lowes of idolatry misinterprets the nature of this attack and tells Hopkins, who, in a fit of jealousy, orders the torture and death of her uncle. Richard hears of these hangings, and deserts the army in order to be by his bethrothed’s side. Standing in the midst of the ruined church, he marries Sara in a mock ceremony, and vows to avenge both her and her uncle by killing Hopkins and Stearne. Matthew Hopkins, menacingly brought to life by legendary actor Vincent Price, was a real-life witch-hunter who operated in the era of English general and Puritan statesman, Oliver Cromwell. This film, the last by director Michael Reeves before his untimely death in 1969, was such a great success (despite its low budget), that it spawned a number of imitators, including the horror classic, “The Bloody Judge” (1969).

In exchange for her uncle’s life, Sara agrees, and all is well until one night Stearne follows Hopkins to her home and learns why the priest has received a reprieve. While Hopkins is away on business in the neighbouring town, Stearne corners Sara and rapes her. One of the men who accused John Lowes of idolatry misinterprets the nature of this attack and tells Hopkins, who, in a fit of jealousy, orders the torture and death of her uncle. Richard hears of these hangings, and deserts the army in order to be by his bethrothed’s side. Standing in the midst of the ruined church, he marries Sara in a mock ceremony, and vows to avenge both her and her uncle by killing Hopkins and Stearne. Matthew Hopkins, menacingly brought to life by legendary actor Vincent Price, was a real-life witch-hunter who operated in the era of English general and Puritan statesman, Oliver Cromwell. This film, the last by director Michael Reeves before his untimely death in 1969, was such a great success (despite its low budget), that it spawned a number of imitators, including the horror classic, “The Bloody Judge” (1969).
